section_purpose: To outline the limitations of the GraSS approach, including its data requirements and inability to easily adapt to online learning scenarios.
key_points: Deep learning methods like GNNs are data-hungry and require large training sets for optimal performance.
In scenarios with limited data, the performance may not be competitive against simpler models.
The method cannot be readily adapted to online learning due to the need for runtime labels on every solver per instance and the challenge of adapting GNNs to online learning.
reproducibility_notes: Large training datasets are necessary for effective performance.
Access to runtime labels for all solvers on each instance is required, which may not be feasible in online settings.
Challenges in adapting GNNs to online learning should be considered for future work or alternative approaches.
